title: The Adventures of John Stensholt
text:
The one thing you have to watch out when you're aboard the Bombardier – whether it be from Essendon or Teterboro – is the steep ascent upon takeoff.

Especially if you've got a glass of Bollinger on the table.

That would be the main lesson from close to a decade of charting the fortunes of the rich. If you've got a good glass of champagne in front of you and the plane is taking off, hold on to the damn thing tight or you'll wear it.

Sometimes John Stensholt (right) gets to go on adventures too Louie Douvis

And if that happens, your billionaire host is unlikely to be impressed. And you won't like having to clean the suit you bought on the Via dei Coronari in Rome to go with the shoes you bought at Footlocker (they're very comfortable – and I can't keep up this pretence, forever).

Anyway, this almost happened once upon a time. Thankfully my mate Damon was along for the ride and was able to grab the bubbles as we were heading down the runway.
description: John Stensholt's lessons from close to a decade of charting the fortunes of the rich.
